section.heading: Effect of recognition of foreign-country judgment.
section.text: If the court in a proceeding under § 15-366 finds that the foreign-country judgment is entitled to recognition under this subchapter, to the extent that the foreign-country judgment grants or denies recovery of a sum of money, the foreign-country judgment is:

para.text: Conclusive between the parties to the same extent as the judgment of a sister state entitled to full faith and credit in the District of Columbia would be conclusive; and
Enforceable in the same manner and to the same extent as a judgment rendered in the District of Columbia.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 7 of the Uniform Foreign-Country Money Judgments Recognition Act.
